title: Basic Economics Quiz
subject: Economics
description: This quiz covers fundamental concepts in basic economics. It will test your understanding of key principles and theories.

questions.text: What is the definition of economics?

answers.text: The study of money and its uses
The study of how people choose to use resources
The study of politics and government
The study of human behavior
The money spent on a choice
The benefit of the next best alternative foregone
The time spent on a decision
The cost of an opportunity

questions.text: Which term describes the additional satisfaction or utility that a person receives from consuming an additional unit of a good or service?

answers.text: Marginal utility
Total utility
Average utility
Consumer surplus

questions.text: What is the law of demand?

answers.text: As the price of a good rises, the quantity demanded will increase
As the price of a good rises, the quantity demanded will decrease
The higher the demand, the higher the price
Demand is constant regardless of price

questions.text: What does 'elasticity of demand' refer to?

answers.text: How demand changes with consumer preferences
How demand responds to changes in price
How demand affects supply
How much demand there is in the market

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of a perfectly competitive market?

answers.text: There are many buyers and sellers
There are barriers to entry
Products are differentiated
Firms have control over prices

questions.text: What is meant by 'monopoly' in economics?

answers.text: A market with many firms selling similar products
A market where a single firm controls the entire market
A market with a few firms dominating the market
A market with numerous small firms
The total value of all goods and services produced within a country
The total value of all exports and imports of a country
The total income of all citizens of a country
The total value of all investments made within a country
A general increase in prices and fall in the purchasing value of money
A general decrease in prices and increase in the value of money
An increase in the supply of goods
An increase in consumer spending
The use of government spending and taxation to influence the economy
The control of the money supply to influence the economy
The regulation of prices and wages by the government
The policy of borrowing money to finance government projects
